morning.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the early part of the day, from when the sun rises until 12 o’clock in the middle of the day
morning.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I hated those cold winter mornings.
I’m not feeling very well this morning.
He stayed in bed late on Sunday morning.
She took the early morning train.
morning.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the part of the day from 12 o’clock at night until 12 o’clock in the middle of the day
morning.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The phone rang at three in the morning.
It’s four o’clock in the morning.
morning.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: ADJECTIVES/NOUN + morning
Friday/Monday/Saturday etc morning
I’ll see you on Monday morning.
tomorrow morning
Can you have the report ready by tomorrow morning?
yesterday morning
I haven’t seen her since yesterday morning.
this morning
What did you do this morning?
the next morning/the following morning
His meeting was not until the next morning.
late morning
By the time he woke, it was late morning.
the early morning
A light frost covered the fields in the early morning.
a beautiful/fine/sunny morning
Outside it was a beautiful morning.
a cold/frosty morning
Porridge tastes good on a cold morning.
a summer/winter etc morning
They set off on a beautiful spring morning.
morning + NOUN
the morning sun/light/mist
the warmth of the morning sun
a morning coffee/run/swim
She read the paper while drinking her morning coffee.
the morning paper/news
The story was in all the morning papers.
the morning train/flight
She took the morning flight back to London.
early in the morning
He has to get up very early in the morning.
first thing in the morning
She set off first thing in the morning.
from morning till night
He works from morning till night.
in the small hours of the morning
I was woken up in the small hours of the morning by a strange sound.
morning.translation[0].note_box[1].items: You do something in the morning
What time do you get up in the morning?
What time do you get up on the morning?
You do something on Monday/Tuesday etc morning
I was late for work on Thursday morning
Something happens  on the morning of a particular date or event
On the morning of March 15,2008, he was involved in a car accident
Make sure you arrive in plenty of time on the morning of the exam
You use all morning to say that something happens during a whole morning, from beginning to end
I’ve been working hard all morning
I’ve been working hard all the morning
morning.translation[1].definitions[0].de: used to greet someone in the morning
